div.p: This example calls a remote Web service to get a random quote and then displays that quote or a new quote every time the page is loaded.

It shows the separation between the model and view (there is no a model in the previous examples). Here, the model is responsible for calling the Web service and the view for displaying the quote. The Web service represents the back-end and the quote represents the front-end.
The remote Web service is called model.xpl by using the delegation processor:

The Web service is declared to call the interface input containing the endpoint, the operation, and the namespace URI for that operation. The service is called through the <delegation:execute> element of the call document.
The view for this example is pretty straightforward: it simply displays the text of the quote received from the model.
